content: update 10/14/14 did a slight modification for a wrist warmer if you d prefer that last two pics please see http //pollyfoofoo blogspot com/2014/10/mrs-fitz-wrist-warmers-variation-on html original entry well it took a bit of meandering but i finally got results i m happy with i had recently put up a knitted pattern of mrs fitz mitts and wanted to then work up a crocheted version initially i set out to make them as similar as possible knit sts and crochet sts don t really look the same but these sort of developed and i like them so i just went with the flow they still look like something you could wear while toddling about the castle but a bit dressier or perhaps mrs fitz would wear them on a night out specifics re yardage malabrigo mecha merino wool bulky 1 skein 130 yards/100 grams is just enough for 1 pair if doing in 1 color at this size if you need to make pattern adjustments for a larger size you would need 2 skeins/extra yardage i got 2 skeins 260 yards so i could combine 2 colors and i could make 2 pairs the arm is worked first then you turn your work ¼ turn clockwise to work the hand the thumb is created by skipping stitches and making a chain as a bridge over those stitches these mitts are worked flat and seamed when finishing i hope you like them
